meanings.definition: The quality or state of being consecutive.
meanings.sent1: The consecutivenesses of the numbers made it easy to spot the pattern.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained the concept of consecutivenesses using a simple example.
meanings.sent3: The consecutivenesses of the ducks following each other in a line was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The consecutivenesses of the falling dominoes was mesmerizing to watch.
meanings.sent5: The consecutivenesses of the train cars rushing by created a rhythmic sound.

meanings.definition: The condition of following in order or sequence.
meanings.sent1: She appreciated the consecutivenesses of the steps leading up the mountain.
meanings.sent2: The consecutivenesses of events in the story kept the audience engaged.
meanings.sent3: The consecutivenesses of the ants marching in a line was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: The consecutivenesses of the music notes flowed seamlessly from one to the next.
meanings.sent5: The consecutivenesses of the waves crashing onto the shore was calming to watch.
